metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Git Amend
Change Platform:
What is Git Amend?
Git Amend is a command that allows you to modify the most recent commit.
content.html: Git Amend is a command that allows you to modify the most recent commit.

content.text: You can use it to fix typos, add or remove files, or change the commit message.
content.html: You can use it to fix typos, add or remove files, or change the commit message.

content.text: When to Use Git Amend
Use Git Amend when you need to make small changes to your last commit.
content.html: Use Git Amend when you need to make small changes to your last commit.

content.text: It's perfect for fixing mistakes, adding forgotten files, or updating the commit message.
content.html: It's perfect for fixing mistakes, adding forgotten files, or updating the commit message.

content.text: Fix Last Commit Message
To change the last commit message, follow these steps:
content.html: To change the last commit message, follow these steps:

content.code_html: git commit --amend -m "Corrected commit message"

content.text: Add Files to Last Commit
To add files to the last commit, follow these steps:
content.html: To add files to the last commit, follow these steps:

content.code_html:
git add forgotten.txt
git commit --amend

content.text: Remove Files from Last Commit
To remove files from the last commit, follow these steps:
content.html: To remove files from the last commit, follow these steps:

content.code:
git
reset HEAD^ -- unwanted.txt

git
commit --amend
1 file changed, 3 insertions(+), 1 deletion(-)
content.code_html:
git reset HEAD^ -- unwanted.txt
git commit --amend
 1 file changed, 3 insertions(+), 1 deletion(-)

content.text: Now let's check the log :

content.code:
git
log --oneline
07c5bc5 (HEAD -> master) Adding plines to reddme
9a9add8 (origin/master) Added .gitignore
81912ba Corrected spelling error
3fdaa5b Merge pull request #1 from w3schools-test/update-readme
836e5bf (origin/update-readme, update-readme) Updated readme for GitHub Branches
daf4f7c (origin/html-skeleton, html-skeleton) Updated index.html with basic meta
facaeae (gh-page/master) Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/w3schools-test/hello-world
e7de78f Updated index.html. Resized image
5a04b6f Updated README.md with a line about focus
d29d69f Updated README.md with a line about GitHub
e0b6038 merged with hello-world-images after fixing conflicts
1f1584e added new image
dfa79db updated index.html with emergency fix
0312c55 Added image to Hello World
09f4acd Updated index.html with a new line
221ec6e First release of Hello World!
content.code_html:
git log --oneline

content.text: Oh no! the commit message is full of spelling errors.
content.html: Oh no! the commit message is full of spelling errors.

content.text: Embarrassing. Let's amend that:

content.code:
git
commit --amend -m
"Added lines to README.md"

[master eaa69ce] Added lines to README.md
Date: Thu Apr 22 12:18:52 2021 +0200
1 file changed, 3 insertions(+), 1 deletion(-))
content.code_html:
git commit --amend -m "Added lines to README.md"
[master eaa69ce] Added lines to README.md
 Date: Thu Apr 22 12:18:52 2021 +0200
 1 file changed, 3 insertions(+), 1 deletion(-))

content.text: We see the previous commit is replaced with our amended one!
content.html: We see the previous commit is replaced with our amended one!

content.text: Warning: Messing with the commit history of a repository can be dangerous.
content.html: Warning: Messing with the commit history of a repository can be dangerous.

content.text: It is usually ok to make these kinds of changes to your own local repository.
content.html: It is usually ok to make these kinds of changes to your own local repository.

content.text: However, you should avoid making changes that rewrite history to remote repositories, especially if others are working with them.
content.html: However, you should avoid making changes that rewrite history to remote repositories, especially if others are working with them.

content.text: Git Amend Files
Adding files with --amend works the same way as above.
content.html: Adding files with --amend works the same way as above.

content.text: Just add them to the staging environment before committing.
content.html: Just add them to the staging environment before committing.
